name: notably
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
C1 especially or most importantly: The company is beginning to attract investors, most notably big Japanese banks.
to an important degree, or in a way that can or should be noticed: The newspapers are notably biased.
More examplesFewer examplesA great deal has been achieved, most notably free elections.A number of members were notably absent from the meeting.Some countries, notably France and Japan, have large nuclear power generating capacities.Warhol's subjects included celebrities, notably movie stars Elizabeth Taylor and Marilyn Monroe.Superman inspired the creation of other comic book heroes, notably Captain Marvel and Batman.
